ygData.subject: UNSUBSCRIBE
ygData.msgSnippet: PLEASE TAKE ME OFF YOUR MAILING LIST!  THANK YOU ... From:  To:  Sent: Tuesday, February 26, 2002 6:18 AM
ygData.messageBody:
PLEASE TAKE ME OFF YOUR MAILING LIST! THANK YOU

> Message: 3
> Date: Mon, 25 Feb 2002 14:52:10 -0000
> From: "Richard Skelton" <richards@...>
> Subject: Archery
>
> Hi there!
>
> Are there any high level Rangers on this list that could tell me a little
about Archery please? I created a Woodelf Ranger yesterday and planned to
focus on this skill, but a friend has just told me that Archery is broken
and serves no purpose but to pull albeit from great distances. I was hoping
that a well developed archer, along with snare could do most damage to mobs
before its arrival. If this not true I find it staggering. Its fine for
casters to snare, DD and DoT - ie fighting from a distance, but not
bow-wielders?
> Any advice and general observations would be kindly met
>
> Thanks
>
> Legless, 8 Ranger
>
> Aka Rykk Bloodfang, 52 Monk
>
>

> Message: 4
> Date: Mon, 25 Feb 2002 07:22:33 -0800 (PST)
> From: Rob LeBeau <rlebeau65@...>
> Subject: Re: problems
>
> Some more questions for you.
>
> 1. Is this card new and did this start happening once
> he card was installed?
>
> 2. Did you install the software from the CD that came
> with it, or have you downloaded the LATEST driver for
> the card?
>
> 3. Not so much a question but I searched my machine
> for that file and it is in Windows\System which means
> it is an Operating System file.
>
> Search the web for this file and see what you get. I
> will myself and get back to you.
>
> Good luck
>
> --- Justin <pavisoj@...> wrote:
> > Does anyone know how to fix the following
> > problem? I can log onto the sever screen and chose
> > my server but when I click play everquest i get a
> > eggame caused an error in DINPUT8.DLL I have tryed
> > to fix it by restarting the system like they day to
> > but get no results. I have a GeForce3 TI 200 video
> > card. I was wondering if anyone else has had this
> > problem.
> >
>
>
> __________________________________________________
> Do You Yahoo!?
> Yahoo! Sports - Coverage of the 2002 Olympic Games
> http://sports.yahoo.com
>
>
> ________________________________________________________________________
> ________________________________________________________________________
>
> Message: 5
> Date: Mon, 25 Feb 2002 08:26:28 -0800 (PST)
> From: Rob LeBeau <rlebeau65@...>
> Subject: Re: problems
>
> Ok,
>
> here is my suggestion.
>
> Launch your machine and close all programs.
> Go to the Windows\System directory and RENAME the file
> DINPUT8.DLL to DINPUT8.old (Right click on it and
> choose rename, type in the new name and hit enter)
>
> Direct X 8.05A or better - you can either download
> this previously or after the rename.
>
> Now, reinstall DirectX and after the installation
> reboot the computer. Close all running APPS and NOW
> try to run Everquest.
>
> Let me know how it goes.
>
> Rob
>
>
>
> --- Justin <pavisoj@...> wrote:
> > Does anyone know how to fix the following

> Message: 8
> Date: Mon, 25 Feb 2002 10:08:29 -0800
> From: "Philip Harrelson" <pharr@...>
> Subject: RE: problems
>
>
>
> Great idea! I had him run dxdiag already (we took this off list) and
> nothing came up bad. all passed. After discussing it further, Justin
> revealed that he has a new "USB" DSL modem. After searching the MS
> Knowledge base, found an article referring to Dinput8.dll and a conflict
> with a USB device. I suspect that you are waiting for 0-patch-thirty to
> come so that you can try try again.
>
> Happy Hunting!
>
> Phil
> Druzzil Ro
>
>
>

> Message: 9
> Date: Mon, 25 Feb 2002 10:45:40 -0800
> From: "Nygaard, Jeff" <jeff.nygaard@...>
> Subject: RE: Re: Subject: groups
>
> Jeff Gaurdry said "Shows how much I go to Luclin. (worst expansion yet? in
a
> word... YES.)
>
> I wouldn't rate the expansion from best to worst. Every expansion offers
> something new. The high lights for the latest expansion is the new world
> graphics, character graphics, alternative advancement skills and more new
> zones added than ever before. Now to class this as the worst expansion
ever
> might be your personal view, but I can guarantee that eyes on Verant and
> many of their customers, it was the best expansion ever.
>
> The alternative advancement skills are one of the best things Verant could
> have come up with. There is no telling how many accounts would have been
> canceled if there was no way of building / leveling your character after
you
> hit level 60. The AA alone is the biggest A+ they could have done. The new
> world graphics are great when you compare what EQ use to look like before.
I
> have mixed feelings on the new character models, some I like and other ok,
> but in general, I like the new models.
>
> But I believe this was the worst expansion when it comes to functions
> working properly on release date. Too many things went wrong on release
date
> to mention. Broken quests, loot table all messed up with your normal 3 day
> after release they patch the loot table fixes. But looking at the big
> picture, I can't really blame Verant for the holding the release date and
> sticking to it. Everyone is out to make money. Releasing SoL just before
> Christmas was ideal for to get those extra sales for new EQ accounts. On
the
> other hand, I do blame them for not beta testing SoL hard enough. Hire an
> extra dozen personnel, work 16 hour shifts, do everything possible to make
> the release date as smooth as possible. Smooth, it was not.
>
> To sum up my point, it is hard to call one expansion over another the
worst.
> When it comes to content, expansion 2 was better than 3 or expansion 3
> release was a lot worse than all others. It is really hard for me to
single
> out any one of the expansions and call it the worst. IMHO they all have
> their good points and bad, and SoV had way too many good points for me to
> down on it.
>
> Just my 1 gold, 4 silver and 18 copper,
>
> Sistily
> Gnome Warlord
>
>
>
> -----Original Message-----

> >North Karana via the Antonica Scion. In which case
>
> *grin* Shows how much I go to Luclin. (worst expansion
> yet? in a word... YES.)
>
> >you have to go through East Karana, Highpass,
> >and then West Commons. I think it's actually safer
>
> With a Camo and not travelling thru Kithicor at night
> it's not too bad a run, but pestering a druid for a
> camo and hoping it doesn't wear off is a hassle. The
> boat is probabl a better plan. The other option is
> shelling the ten plat to get a port from a Druid or
> Wizzy to WC. Much faster. :)
>
>

> Message: 14
> Date: Mon, 25 Feb 2002 23:29:16 -0000
> From: "bigmaca3" <bigmaca3@...>
> Subject: Re: Archery
>
> --- In EverQuest@y..., "Richard Skelton" <richards@h...> wrote:
> > Hi there!
> >
> > Are there any high level Rangers on this list that could tell me a
> little about Archery please? I created a Woodelf Ranger yesterday
> and planned to focus on this skill, but a friend has just told me
> that Archery is broken and serves no purpose but to pull albeit from
> great distances. I was hoping that a well developed archer, along
> with snare could do most damage to mobs before its arrival. If this
> not true I find it staggering. Its fine for casters to snare, DD and
> DoT - ie fighting from a distance, but not bow-wielders?
> > Any advice and general observations would be kindly met
> >
> > Thanks
> >
> > Legless, 8 Ranger
> >
> > Aka Rykk Bloodfang, 52 Monk
> >
>
> Well, I guess 33 seasons has given me a little experience with the
> bow. First, the procedure is called bow kiting. You snare your
> prey, DoT it and run backwards sticking arrows in it until the snare
> breaks. Then hopefully you've done enough damage to finish it off
> with your sword(s). I still do this, though only with blue's.
>
> And your friend was sorta right. It's not bugged so much as it's not
> very effective. Arrows cost, even if you make them yourself. And
> what self-respecting Ranger doesn't fletch his own bows and arrows?
> Even with a quiver to speed up your recovery time you really can't
> stick a lot of arrows into your prey. I can get them down to about
> 60% on a good day. Now if you can get one of the high damage bows
> early you may have a better time at this. The Trueshot is attainable
> to low levels, and you may get lucky!
>
> The other problem is running backwards sometimes get's you into more
> trouble! Especially if your prey is prone to having like creatures
> join in. Or Grimfeather comes along! And Rangers can't quad kite!
>
> And you'll find pulling with a bow to be risky in some places. It's
> too easy to get a train started. Not that I'm speaking from prior
> experience here!
>
> Yes, I would have liked Rangers to be the preeminent Archery class.
> We share crits with Warriors, and have a few specials once we hit 50,
> but that's it. Yes, we have dual wield, double attack lightning
> swords of death! Gotta watch that too.
>
> Good hunting!
>
> Tul
>
>
>
> ________________________________________________________________________
> ________________________________________________________________________
>
> Message: 15
> Date: Tue, 26 Feb 2002 01:57:54 -0000
> From: "mlockridge01" <MLockridge01@...>
> Subject: Re: Archery
>
> -As a warrior, I planned the use of archery as a pulling tool. I
> didn't expect to do much damage with the bow. I just figured on
> fletching and making bows and learning how to use the skill to it's
> best as I learned the game from a warrior's perspective.
>
> The site by the name "Fletching Guide by Aoenla" has some nice info.
> You might look there. And "EQ Traders Corner" has good stuff as well.
>
> I am rather new to fletching, so as I learn more I will try to share.
>
> Bartoo
> Halfling Warrior
> Zeb Server
>

> Message: 16
> Date: Tue, 26 Feb 2002 02:06:38 -0000
> From: "mlockridge01" <MLockridge01@...>
> Subject: Re: Help
>
> Your own newbie zone is usually the best place to start. You learn
> the most with the least risk. Also, leveling is only part of the
> game. Explore trade skills, shopping from vendors, and trading with
> players. Take enough time to learn all you can from your first newbie
> experience. Once you have leveled your first character, you may want
> to power level some of your alternate characters. Or, taking the long
> road to leveling for alts may appeal to you.
>
> Take your time. Every level has it's own challenges and pleasures.
> Have fun on your EverQuest.
>
> Barto Proudfoot
> Halfling Druid
> Zeb Server
>
